definition: time flies like an arrow (idiom); How time flies!
overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia

sentences.english: That formerly how to pick, time flies straight forward.
sentences.chinese: 翀那段從前怎麼去撿，光陰似箭一直向前。

sentences.english: Time flies quicky and the time we have is quite limited.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，而我們所擁有的時間又極其有限。

sentences.english: My college life As a sophomore, I am feeling the time flies.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一名大二年的學生，我覺得光陰似箭。

sentences.english: The flight of time, in a short moment, everything into the distant past.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，彈指之間，一切都化爲遙遠的往昔。

sentences.english: How time flies! In a twinkling of an eye it is already 4 years since China acceded to the World Trade Organization ( WTO ).
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，轉眼中國加入世貿組織已經整整4年。

sentences.english: The bad news is time flies.
Time flies; we're already at the year's end.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，已經到了年底了。

sentences.english: Time passes quickly, and now we are at the first anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，日月如梭，今天是他逝世後的第一個週年。

sentences.english: In fact, people say time flies.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，人們說光陰似箭。

sentences.english: Time is like an arrow, time elapse quickly, 50 years extraordinary years blends in historical endless flow.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，日月如梭，50年崢嶸歲月融入歷史長河。

sentences.english: Time passes very quickly. In fact, people say time flies.
sentences.chinese: 時間過得很快，事實上，人們說光陰似箭。

sentences.english: How time flies, this school term will have been over in a flash.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，轉瞬之間，這個學期就要結束了。

sentences.english: Years Rusuo, time flies, six primary school life, a brief span.
sentences.chinese: 歲月如梭，光陰似箭，六年小學生活，彈指一揮間。

sentences.english: Life is short.Tick tock, tick tick.
As a sophomore, I feel that the time flies.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個大二學生，我覺得光陰似箭。

sentences.english: When you take a ski vacation with your kids, do you feel like time flies by?
sentences.chinese: 當你滑雪度假與您的孩子，你感覺光陰似箭嗎？

definition: a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
lit. the cycle comes back to the start (idiom); to move in circles/the wheel comes full circle
wine goblets and gambling chips lie intertwined/to drink and gamble together in a large group (idiom)/a big (drinking) party
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
lit. the falling of one leaf heralds the coming of autumn (idiom)/fig. a small sign can indicate a great trend/a straw in the wind
lit. the rear waves of the Yangtze River drive on those before (idiom)/fig. the new is constantly replacing the old/each new generation excels the previous/(of things) to be constantly evolving
pinyin: Chang2 Jiang1 hou4 lang4 tui1 qian2 lang4
